name: Mount Avalon

trails_config.name: Avalon Trail
trails_config.description: Starting right behind the railroad depot at Crawford Notch, the Avalon Trail leads gently at first, then steeply for the last 0.5 mile to the summit of Mt. Avalon. The rocky spur at the top delivers a jaw-dropping view down Crawford Notch and across to Mt. Webster’s cliffs. Many hikers stop here en route to higher peaks like Field and Tom, but Avalon itself is a worthy destination for an afternoon hike, offering one of the best low-elevation views in the Whites.

current_conditions.ai_summary: A spectacular hike located in New Hampshire. Standing at 3440 feet, Mount Avalon offers breathtaking views and a rewarding challenge for hikers of all levels.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 3440 feet, Mount Avalon is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its approachable and scenic terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Avalon Trail**, a **3.4 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **local peak challenge**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **Mount Webster**, which is just 0.4 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.
